result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl S. Ganzen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any illegal substances as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon premises where he has cause to believe such contraband may be present.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall take prescription medications in manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall obtain all his prescriptions from one (1) pharmacy.
Defendant shall report any change in medication or appointments to his Agent within 48 hours.

Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Ct. #1, Ct. #2 and Ct. #5.  Ct. #3 and Ct. #4 D&RI.
Def. is not requesting a PSI.
Statements by DA Snider - the firearms can be returned to Paul, Carl's father - the Court directs the SO to surrender all firearms to Paul.

Probation - SW - 3 years.
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action on Ct. #1 and Ct. #2 - Ct. #5 - pay fine of $100.00 + costs = 654.00
2.  def. to provide DNA sample.
3.  def. to pay supervision fees.
4.  def. to participate in any assessments or counseling as directed by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
5.  def. to not possess or consume any illegal substances as defined in Chapter 961 - not to go upon premises where he has cause to believe such contraband may be present.
6.  def. to take prescription medications in manner and method as prescribed by his physician - obtain all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy - def. to report any change in medication or appointments to his Agent w/in 48 hours.
7.  def. to perform 90 CSW hours (30 hours each year of probation).
0 days credit if revoked (the Court was unsure at the time of any days credit).

Firearm restrictions explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
